definition: best of its kind/cream of the crop

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Soon he became the top student at school.
sentences.chinese: 很快他便成了學校裏的尖子生。

sentences.english: We picked the perfect top two.
sentences.chinese: 我們挑出了最尖子的兩個選手。

sentences.english: He is a top student, a really good one.
sentences.chinese: 他是個尖子學生，沒有說的。

sentences.english: The same holds true for many of the straight-A students I researched for my book.
sentences.chinese: 這兩個事實也應驗在我書中調查過的許多尖子生身上。

sentences.english: Whst do you think of the standard of the top Chinese shooters?
sentences.chinese: 尖子射擊運動員的水平如何？

sentences.english: Wendy Wang, 15, is one of the top students in Shenzhen.
sentences.chinese: 十五歲的王溫迪是深圳尖子生之一。

sentences.english: The top students in our class can't work out the problem. It must be very difficult.
sentences.chinese: 我班的尖子生都不能做出那題，它一定很難。

sentences.english: Wendy Wang, 15 must be one of the top students in Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 十五歲的王溫迪肯定是上海的尖子生之一。

sentences.english: Yeah, our class gathered the best students from Junior 2.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我們班彙集了初二段的所有尖子生。

sentences.english: We always consider him to be a top student.
sentences.chinese: 我們一直認爲他是個尖子生。

sentences.english: He is the best student of English in the class.
sentences.chinese: 他是全班學生中的英語尖子。

sentences.english: She was the top student in English II, (10)the apple of Mrs. Larrivee's eye.
sentences.chinese: 她是英語二班的尖子，拉里維太太的掌上明珠。

sentences.english: He is considered a top student in our class.
sentences.chinese: 他被認爲是我們班的尖子生。

sentences.english: He is the head boy of our class, and is frequently praised by teachers.
sentences.chinese: 他是我們班的尖子生，總被老師誇。

sentences.english: I was one of the top students in the class.
sentences.chinese: 我學習很好，我是我們班的尖子生。

sentences.english: I'm now top of my class.

definition: top-notch (colloquial)/to push oneself to the front
erhua variant of 拔尖[ba2 jian1]
parade guards (usually spaced out along parade routes)/example/model/pacesetter
one in a hundred/cream of the crop
warrant officer/petty officer/noncommissioned officer (NCO)/Japanese military officer
(of a child) apple of one's eye
to rise through the ranks (as a party cadre)
military sports/military fitness (curriculum etc)/abbr. for 軍事體育|军事体育
